article.Heading: Budget 2016: Finance Minister raises service tax by 0.5% on the sly
article.Summary: The Krishi Kalyan Cess, at 0.5 percent will be levied on all taxable services effective June 1, 2016.
article.Body:
Rishma Kapur
moneycontrol.com

While the street is rejoicing at no apparent increase in the service tax, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley did manage to increase it slightly by 0.5 percent in the form of Krishi Kalyan cess.

The Krishi Kalyan Cess, at 0.5 percent will be levied on all taxable services effective June 1, 2016. The proceeds of the cess will be exclusively used for financing initiatives for improvement in agriculture and upliftment of farmers. Input tax credit of the cess will be available for payment of this cess.

Currently, the service tax stands at 14.5 percent comprising of 14 percent service tax and 0.5 percent Swachh Bharat Cess. Including the Krishi Kalyan Cess, the service tax now stands at 15 percent.
